title: Detailed Chip Package Definition
description: Defines properties of a chip package, including precise physical layout for script-driven rendering, pin characteristics, and peripheral mapping.

partInfo.description: Basic information about the chip part and package.

datasheetVersion.description: Version of the datasheet this definition is based on.

sizeDescription.description: Overall physical dimensions (e.g., '7mm x 7mm x 0.85mm body').

renderConfig.description: Parameters for rendering the package in the application.

padding.description: Default padding around the package within the canvas, in 'units' or pixels if units are abstract.

chipBody.description: Visual and dimensional properties of the chip body.

width.description: Width of the chip body in 'units'.

height.description: Height of the chip body in 'units'.

centerX.description: X-coordinate of the chip body's center (application can define origin, e.g., canvas center).

centerY.description: Y-coordinate of the chip body's center.

cornerRadius.description: Corner radius if shape is 'rect', in 'units'.

orientationMarker.description: Visual marker for pin 1 or package orientation.

size.description: Diameter or length of the marker in 'units'.

offsetX.description: X offset from chipBody centerX in 'units'.

offsetY.description: Y offset from chipBody centerY in 'units'.

pinDefaults.description: Default visual properties for all pins. Can be overridden per pin.

width.description: Default width/diameter of a pin in 'units'.

height.description: Default height of a pin (if applicable, e.g., for rects) in 'units'.

socPeripherals.description: Defines the capabilities and requirements of SoC-level peripherals. This information is characteristic of the SoC die itself.

id.description: Unique identifier for this SoC peripheral instance (e.g., 'SPIM0', 'UARTE0', 'TIMER2', 'SAADC').

baseAddress.description: Base memory address of the peripheral (e.g., '0x4000A000').

description.description: Brief description of the peripheral's function.

signals.description: Defines the individual signals (pins/lines) this peripheral requires or provides.

name.description: Logical name of the signal from the SoC's perspective (e.g., 'SCK', 'MOSI', 'RXD', 'SCL', 'AIN0', 'PWM_OUT0', 'EVENT_CHANNEL_0').

direction.description: Signal direction relative to the SoC peripheral.

isMandatory.description: Is this signal essential for the peripheral's basic operation?

requiresClockCapablePin.description: Does this signal require connection to a GPIO pin designated as 'clock capable' in the 'pins' array?

items.description: An SoC-level GPIO specifier. Use format 'P<port>*' (e.g., 'P0*') for all pins in a port, or 'P<port>.<pin>' (e.g., 'P0.01', 'P1.10') for a specific pin. Pin numbers are typically 1 or 2 digits.

allowedGpio.description: A list of SoC-level GPIO specifiers indicating which GPIOs or GPIO ports a signal can be routed through. This refined list is considered before package-specific pin mappings. For example, ['P0*', 'P1.00', 'P1.01'].

driveStrengthRequirement.description: Recommended or required GPIO drive strength if this signal is an output.

specialNotes.description: Any special considerations for this signal (e.g., 'Pull-up recommended', 'Requires external components').

pins.description: Detailed list of all physical pins on this package.

packagePinId.description: Unique physical identifier on the package (e.g., '1', '48', 'A1', 'G7').

renderOrder.description: For perimeter layouts, the sequential drawing order if 'packagePinId' is not numeric/sequential.

side.description: For perimeter layouts, which side the pin is on.

x.description: Explicit X coordinate (center) in 'units', for 'customExplicitLayout' or to override calculated.

rotation.description: Rotation in degrees (0 is typically pointing outwards for perimeter pins).

peripheralPinMappings.description: Defines how SoC peripherals map to pins on this specific package.

socPeripheralId.description: Must match an 'id' from the 'socPeripherals' list.

systemPins.description: Pins with fixed, system-level functions critical for this package's operation.

pinCounts.description: Number of pins on each side.

pinPitch.description: Distance between centers of adjacent pins on a side, in 'units'.

corner.description: Relative corner/edge of the side where pin numbering starts.

pinOffsetFromEdge.description: Distance from the chip body edge to the center of the pin's base, in 'units'.

pitchX.description: Horizontal distance between pin/ball centers, in 'units'.

pitchY.description: Vertical distance between pin/ball centers, in 'units'.

originOffset.description: X,Y offset of the center of the first pin (e.g., A1) from the chipBody center (0,0), in 'units'.

labelOriginConvention.description: Defines if 'A1' is the top-left or bottom-left pin of the grid.

description.default: Pins are positioned using their explicit x, y, rotation properties.
